III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was provided in the area of documentation in personnel files of
staff on long-term medical leave, clarity in the documentation of health assessments and
services provided and detailed narratives within service plans and discharge forms.
V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was provided during this inspection.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
N/A
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
07/08/2025. Staff reported positive experiences at the facility. They felt they were
able to make a difference with the youth placed and the programming allowed
youth and staff to be safe.
Youth were interviewed during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
07/08/2025. Youth reported positive experiences being placed at the facility. They
all consistently expressed perspective about the detention program but commented
that they felt safe and well cared for.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility was toured with the Deputy Director during an announced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 07/08/2025. The facility was in clean and organized condition
inside the building and outside in the secure yard area. Medications were stored
properly in the medical area of the facility. No concerns were noted.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
